message:
The Annual Gymkhana Award Ceremony was held on the 18th of April at the Netaji Auditorium.

The ceremony saw the winners of the Gymkhana Awards in Technology, the 5th Inter IIT Tech Meet and the Technology General Championship being felicitated for their efforts and excellence.

The Technology Students' Gymkhana would like to congratulate all the awardees, and wishes them all the best for their future.
story: Technology, IIT Kharagpur added 50 new photos to the album: Gymkhana Awards 2016-2017 — with Anusha Sharan and Anmol Shakya.

message:
Following is the list of Gymkhana Awardees in the Technology category for the academic session 2016-2017.

The Technology Students’ Gymkhana would like to show its appreciation and thank these individuals for their immense and invaluable contribution to the student body and the institute, by felicitating them during the Annual Gymkhana Award Distribution Ceremony.

Following is the list of Gymkhana Awardees in the Technology category for the academic session 2016-2017.

The Technology Students’ Gymkhana would like to show its appreciation and thank these individuals for their immense and invaluable contribution to the student body and the institute, by felicitating them during the Annual Gymkhana Award Distribution Ceremony.

Following is the list of Gymkhana Awardees in the Technology category for the academic session 2016-2017.

The Technology Students’ Gymkhana would like to show its appreciation and thank these individuals for their immense and invaluable contribution to the student body and the institute, by felicitating them during the Annual Gymkhana Award Distribution Ceremony.

Following is the list of Gymkhana Awardees in the Technology category for the academic session 2016-2017.

The Technology Students’ Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur would like to show its appreciation and thank these individuals for their immense and invaluable contribution to the student body, by felicitating them with the below-mentioned awards in the Annual Gymkhana Award Distribution Ceremony, to be held on the 18th of April.

Gymkhana awards 2016 - 2017

Application for the gymkhana awards in the genre of technology are invited for
1) Prof. G S Sanyal Cup.
2) Order of merit.
3) Hon'ble mention.
4) Ashoke Mukherjee Cup (Outgoing student who has made outstanding voluntary contribution to the Gymkhana)
CVs should be emailed to tech.gymkhana@gmail.com by 11/04/2017 at 6 pm. All the relevant documents (supporting points mentioned in the CV) should be mailed along with the CV.
In the resumes following information can be included:
*Participation in the GC.
*Position of responsibilities.
*Participation in tech events (eg. KTJ, out station participation).
*Inter IIT Tech achievements. 
*Meaningful projects and technical papers.
*National/International conferences.
Regards

Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur is conducting Open IIT Code Conclave with CodeChef on 9th April. The details are mentioned here - (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1mvS6uhweW0u5G9ItWUaUTf3CvyqITRL69ibjjymRx3I/edit?usp=sharing).Please mail your usernames to codeconclave@gmail.com before Friday 11:45 PM.Exciting goodies for the top 10 students!!

AFTER THE HUGE SUCCESS OF NAVARACHANAA 2016
We are back to have the same technical blast as we had done in the 2016.
So here we introduce the National level project competition
*NAVARACHANAA-2017* from* 30th March, 2017* to *31st March, 2017 *with
themes,
1) Digital India 
2) Make in India
3) Skill India/ Startup India
4) Smart city
5) Swachh Bharat Abhiyan
6)General Category
We are glade to invite you for this phenomenal opportunity to showcase your
ideas and Implementation as a cherishing outcome in the contribution to the
Nation's Dream.
For further Details:-
navarachanaa@svvv.edu.in

5th Inter IIT Tech Meet

Note: Deadline has been extended till 24th Feb, 8 pm

We have started accepting CVs for the events of 5th Inter IIT Tech Meet.

The criteria for CV shortlisting will be based on:
1. Relevant skills
2. Past Experience in Relevant field
3. Achievements in Relevant field
Make sure you prepare your CV accordingly. The CV should not be more than 1 page.

 The CVs along with all the proving certificates/documents are to be mailed to interiittechmeet.kgp@gmail.com with the Subject "*Event Name* - CV Shortlisting". Any e-mails with any other subject won't be considered. All the files and scanned copies should 
be strictly in pdf format.

Deadline for submission: 22/02/17 8 pm

**Note: There will be a different selection criteria for Messier Marathon. It will be revealed later.

Hello KGP!

5th Inter IIT Tech Meet has finally been confirmed and is being held at IIT Kanpur from 24th - 26th March, 2017. A doc for the brief description of events is attached below. 

Refer the doc for knowing your interests and start preparing for the same. The Problem Statements and other details along with the contingent selection criteria will be released soon.

Technology, IIT Kharagpur shared Technology Transfer Group , IIT Kharagpur's photo. In continuation of the ongoing Patent Drive, efforts are being made to protect the inventions by the students and researchers. We would like to identify and protect the technologies to be displayed in the upcoming Techno-management festival Kshitij™. In this regard all the institute participants of Kshitij events especially (i) Eureka, (ii) Embetronics, (iii) Droid Blitz, (iv) Conquest, (v) Arm Of Achelous, (vi) Sandrover, (vii) B.R.I.C.K.S, (viii) Kryotech, (ix) Anadigix and (x) Initiative Prakriti are requested to send an abstract along with required drawings of their invention to submissions@ktj.in. "The deadline for the institute participants has been exclusively extended up to the 12th of Jan " The patentable inventions will be recommended for filing after scrutiny by the expert techno-legal committee. Please be assured that Institute will provide all necessary support to protect your valuable inventions. Please note that all your valuable inventions need to be protected by filing the patent before disclosing to the public. This is an excellent opportunity to protect and look for the possible marketability and commercial viability of your inventions. Such protection prevents the unauthorized use of your invention and provides a meaningful exclusionary right to the patent holder. The details of Kshitij events can be found in the following link: http://ktj.in/#ktj/Events

In continuation of the ongoing Patent Drive, efforts are being made to protect the inventions by the students and researchers. We would like to identify and protect the technologies to be displayed in the upcoming Techno-management festival Kshitij™. In this regard all the institute participants of Kshitij events especially (i) Eureka, (ii) Embetronics, (iii) Droid Blitz, (iv) Conquest, (v) Arm Of Achelous, (vi) Sandrover, (vii) B.R.I.C.K.S, (viii) Kryotech, (ix) Anadigix and (x) Initiative Prakriti are requested to send an abstract along with required drawings of their invention to submissions@ktj.in. "The deadline for the institute participants has been exclusively extended up to the 12th of Jan " The patentable inventions will be recommended for filing after scrutiny by the expert techno-legal committee. Please be assured that Institute will provide all necessary support to protect your valuable inventions. Please note that all your valuable inventions need to be protected by filing the patent before disclosing to the public. This is an excellent opportunity to protect and look for the possible marketability and commercial viability of your inventions. Such protection prevents the unauthorized use of your invention and provides a meaningful exclusionary right to the patent holder. The details of Kshitij events can be found in the following link: http://ktj.in/#ktj/Events

Technology, IIT Kharagpur shared Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur's post. As most of you know, the past 4 editions of Inter IIT Tech Meet were being conducted in an un-officialized and informal manner. In order to officialize the Meet, all the 23 IITs are conducting a survey for getting the views of the student community on its conduction. Below is the link to a google form. Please take out 2 minutes from your schedule and fill the form: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSeFeIvLfb8zK6vkwb4w2z7aWcoMyYARzvNQLReS-wmPnOVPjA/viewform?c=0&w=1 PS: It would be great if we can get maximum responses from IIT Kharagpur :)

Can't keep your mind off electrical stuff? This is your chance to unveil your electrifying side to others and exhibit that you have enough potential to make a difference! Participate in Circuitrix Junior and win BONUS MARKS for taking admission in IIIT-Delhi, along with amazing prizes.

Registration is now LIVE!

To register, fill in this form: bit.ly/circuitrixjr-esya16
To know more, visit our website : http://esya.iiitd.edu.in/

Note: This competition is only open for students currently in classes XI and XII.

Technology, IIT Kharagpur shared Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur's post. SRISTI celebrates the creativity and innovation of young technological students by recognising their outstanding projects with Gandhian Young Technological Innovation (GYTI) Awards. These awards are given every year during the Festival of Innovation (FOIN) at Rashtrapati Bhawan in the month of March. Next year, these awards are due tentatively on March 5, 2017 at FOIN. It is hoped that such recognition will enthuse young innovators to pursue even more outstanding research addressing unmet social needs and set up entrepreneurial ventures in consonance with Start-Up movement gaining strength currently in India. Any student project that has been completed during 2014-15 to 2016-17 is eligible for consideration of awards.The students need to submit the projects at following URL: www.gyti.techpedia.in. Financial support is also given to some of the awardees as per numerous windows of opportunity: Last date for submission of entries is November 30, 2016 You can email your queries to gyti.techpedia@sristi.org ,or call at 9099258492.

Technology Students' Gymkhana congratulates the awards recipients!

Gymkhana awards 2015 - 2016

Application for the gymkhana awards in the genre of technology are invited for 

1) Prof. G S Sanyal Cup.
2) Order of merit.
3) Hon'ble mention.
4) Ashoke Mukherjee Cup (Outgoing student who has made outstanding voluntary contribution to the Gymkhana)

CVs should be mailed to gymkhana.kharagpur@gmail.com by 11/04/2016 at 6pm. All the relevant documents (supporting points mentioned in the CV) should be mailed along with the CV.

In the resumes following information can be included:

*Participation in the GC.
*Position of responsibilities.
*Participation in tech events (eg. KTJ, out station participation).
*Inter IIT Tech achievements. 
*Meaningful projects and technical papers.
*National/International conferences.

Regards

message:
A senior astrophysicist at NASA, Prof. Mather is the recipient of 2006 Nobel prize in Physics. He is a senior project scientist at JSWT, which will be successor to Hubble Space Telescope. He was part of the COBE satellite, which confirmed the Big Bang theory. He was listed twice by TIME magazine; among 100 most influential people in the world in 2007 and then again in 2012 among 25 most influential people in space.

Strengthen the foundation of your thoughts through his precious words.

Date: 29th February (Monday), 6:30 PM
Venue: CET Studio 1, First Floor, Takshashila

A senior astrophysicist at NASA, Prof. Mather is the recipient of 2006 Nobel prize in Physics. He is a senior project scientist at JSWT, which will be successor to Hubble Space Telescope. He was part of the COBE satellite, which confirmed the Big Bang theory. He was listed twice by TIME magazine; among 100 most influential people in the world in 2007 and then again in 2012 among 25 most influential people in space.

Strengthen the foundation of your thoughts through his precious words.

Date: 29th February (Monday), 6:30 PM
Venue: CET Studio 1, First Floor, Takshashila

A PAN IIT interactive session with Prof. Herald Haas has been arranged on 14th February at 6:30PM. Prof. Haas holds the Chair of Mobile Communications at the University of Edinburgh. He is acclaimed to be the inventor of Light Fidelity (Li-Fi) which was listed among the 50 best inventions in TIME Magazine 2011.

Link for webcast is http://nknvcreplay.nic.in/replay/webcastShow.html?key=vUUIZ1dDHHitrBr

Link will be live from Sunday (14th Feb.) 6:30 PM onward. Venue for online interaction is NKN Virtual Classroom, JCB Lab Complex.

Note: The event will consist of a keynote speech from 6:30 PM - 8:00 PM. Q&A session will be from 8:15 PM.
